poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Half stricken By an office canteen sometime roast Today re-het and dangerous half-chicken Chomped without a thought While reading (I not it) a piece forgot Before the wiping of the gob. All afternoon My brains in brown-out, not to mention - as we should - The institutional boon of low-cost catering, The routine thrills and spills of what we take for food.
